DOC.brief_summary: The primary endpoint of this study is to investigate the effect of adding nalbuphine to intrathecal morphine on quality of postoperative analgesia and Morphine related side effects post- cesarean delivery.
DOC.brief_title: The Effect of Adding Nalbuphine to Intrathecal Morphine on Analgesic Efficacy and Side Effects After Cesarean Section
DOC.detailed_description: The study will be performed in Assiut University Hospitals, after obtaining approval from the local ethics committee and written informed patient consent. All patients will have a peripheral IV cannula 18 G inserted; standard non-invasive monitors will be applied. All the patients will be preloaded with 10 ml/kg Ringer's lactate solution intravenous. Intrathecal block under strict aseptic conditions will be performed in sitting position at L3-4 or L4-5 inter-spinous space with 25G pencil-point spinal needle. All patients will receive intrathecal 10 mg of 0.5% hyperbaric bupivacaine.
DOC.criteria: Female patients age between 16 to 40 years ASA physical status I II Infection at the site of injection. Coagulopathy or other bleeding diathesis. Preexisting neurologic deficits.
